intro: Agistron erinacea, commonly known as the hairy agistron, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive hairy foliage and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color and bloom in the summer months. Agistron erinacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
